function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited technology, knowledge, and resources make historical solutions to pandemics not applicable worldwide.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of good sunlight and air flow in building design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate cleanliness and surface contamination","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient home designs for covid-19 treatment and prevention","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 in artificial environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and air circulation in homes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate isolation facilities in homes","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of infectious disease transmission in built environments due to changes in living style and architecture.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of isolation room for infected individuals","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sanitation facilities for preventing virus transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adaptability and flexibility in house design","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Choice of interior design facilitating the spread of the virus and virus retention on surfaces.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and indoor air quality leading to increased risk of disease infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exterior and outdoor spaces becoming essential due to the pandemic, leading to potential overcrowding and virus transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased outdoor activities can lead to closer human interactions and spread of contagious diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglecting the value of the house may lead to poor living conditions and lack of hygiene, contributing to the spread of diseases","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of local products and minimal energy consumption in housing may lead to compromised indoor air quality and ventilation, creating a conducive environment for disease transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Viruses spreading in built environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Permanent changes in architectural design and lifestyle","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty of living with contagious viruses long-term","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in indoor spaces leading to the spread of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to social distancing and mask-wearing guidelines","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor hygiene and sanitization practices in shared environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of sar-cov-2 in public spaces due to relaxation of restrictions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term transformation of social interactions in public spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Future uncertainty and fear regarding public space use","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the impact of covid-19 on public space","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in acceptable and radical policies","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for rapid and radical changes in public space usage","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global pandemic causing long-term impacts on planning and design of public spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Refinement of practices in response to the pandemic, leaving fundamental approaches and values unchanged.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The need to integrate new ideas about public health into practice and leverage the crisis to build more just, healthier, and greener cities.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 may change public space design and use, affecting how people interact and move within public spaces.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing due to crowded sidewalks and streets","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate queuing space outside shops and public facilities","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient traffic flow and access control in urban areas","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for drop off and delivery space due to online shopping and home food delivery","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Controversial nature of street redesigns and political challenges","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertainty about mainstreaming health criteria into public space design","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changing preferences and expectations about green spaces due to the pandemic","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"New expectations regarding social distancing within green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for new or expanded exercise infrastructure within green spaces","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of green spaces during stay at home orders may result in overcrowding and difficulty maintaining social distancing.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underused and neglected rooftop spaces may become overcrowded as people seek open air spaces for recreation and socialization.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social interactions in green spaces and rooftop amenities may lead to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Permanent aversion to large public gatherings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in city design due to aversion to gatherings","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Value of large flexible spaces as assets post-covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large gatherings and celebrations may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases due to close contact and crowding.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate planning and design of public spaces may lead to high social density, crowding, and increased public health risks.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"}]}
